name: Word 2016 Expert
subtitle: Document and word processing software
description: This Word 2016 Expert series explores working with long documents by how to create a table of contents, index, footnotes and endnotes, captions, cross references, and a bibliography. Also in long documents, we demonstrate how to create a master document with sub documents for large projects. Other topics in this series include how to collaborate in Word and through Office 365 online, secure your documents, and document properties.  While Word 2016 Expert is a continuation from the Word 2016 Advanced and Essentials series, episodes can be viewed individually for specific topics or in sequence.
descriptionMD: This Word 2016 Expert series explores working with long documents by how to create a table of contents, index, footnotes and endnotes, captions, cross references, and a bibliography. Also in long documents, we demonstrate how to create a master document with sub documents for large projects. Other topics in this series include how to collaborate in Word and through Office 365 online, secure your documents, and document properties.  While Word 2016 Expert is a continuation from the Word 2016 Advanced and Essentials series, episodes can be viewed individually for specific topics or in sequence.

episodes.title: Overview
episodes.description: This Word 2016 Expert series explores working with long documents by how to create a table of contents, index, footnotes and endnotes, captions, cross references, and a bibliography. Also in long documents, we demonstrate how to create a master document with sub documents for large projects. Other topics in this series include how to collaborate in Word and through Office 365 online, secure your documents, and document properties. While Word 2016 Expert is a continuation from the Word 2016 Advanced and Essentials series, episodes can be viewed individually for specific topics or in sequence.

episodes.title: Bookmarks and Cross References
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate and explain using Bookmarks and Cross References. Here they show you Bookmark specifics like marking a location, naming conventions, and selecting a range of content. Then they look at Cross Reference specifics like using hyperlinks and choosing what text to display in the Cross Reference.

episodes.title: Table of Contents
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne show you how to insert a Table of Contents(TOC) into your Word 2016 documents. Here they will go over heading levels, TOC templates, TOC style changes, update field, and removing TOC.

episodes.title: Create Index
episodes.description: Vonne and Daniel show created index, save as for major changes to a document, mark entry, mark all, page range, sub-entries & how to use & create them, create index, update index, format with styles pane, use "concordance file for Auto Mark,' comma vs. colon for creating sub-entries, and remove marked entries with . ^d XE.

episodes.title: Citations and Bibliography
episodes.description: Vonne and Zach look at Cite work, writing styles, what is a 'Bibliography' and various types of bibliography formats, manage sources, adding citation to a document, adding new source, generating a bibliography, and updating a bibliography.

episodes.title: Footnotes and Endnotes
episodes.description: Vonne and Zach discuss the definition of Footnotes & Endnotes, how to navigate in the doc, adding footnotes/endnotes, numbering updates as you add or delete notes, and converting footnotes to endnotes.

episodes.title: Captions and Table of Figures
episodes.description: Vonne and Zach cover adding captions to graphical items, generating a table of figures, using the add/delete new caption function, and the importance of adding captions when figures are in the final location.

episodes.title: Master Document
episodes.description: Vonne and Zach define what a ‘Master Document’ is, how to create links to subdocuments, MUST use headings, using print preview/master document becomes a regular file, making changes to subdocument files, making changes in master file, creating a TOC (Table of Contents) index, adding outlining tab buttons to quickly access toolbar, and how to un-link subdocuments.

episodes.title: Track Changes
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne show you how to track changes to your documents in Word 2016. Here you will specifically learn how to enable/disable tracking, how the document displays changes through markup, and accepting/rejecting changes.

episodes.title: Compare and Combine Documents
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne take a look at two separate, yet related functions...Comparing and Combining. First they explore using the Comparing feature which allows you to basically set two documents side-by-side to check for differences. Next they show you how to combine two copies of the same document that have been edited by two different users, merging the edits into one master document.

episodes.title: Collaborate Online
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne take a look at Word 2016's collaboration features. Here they will show you how to collaborate with others to make edits and make notes in your documents through email or cloud services. They will explain how to invite collaborators, chat in real time, and remove sharing when necessary.

episodes.title: Document Security
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne go over some important security features found in Word 2016. Specific features you'll see here includes, hidden text, restrict editing, and adding password protection to a document.

episodes.title: Document Security Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne continue looking at security features found in Word 2016. They round out the topic by showing you how to restrict access to documents as well as covering the basics of working with digital signatures.

episodes.title: Document Security Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne continue looking at security features in Word 2016. Here they finish by looking at a few more details with regards to editing restrictions.

episodes.title: Document Properties
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate working with Document Properties which will help make a document more searchable as well as adding more usable information to a document. This is also known as meta-data.

episodes.title: Forms
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore the exciting world of Forms in Word 2016. Here they will show you how to create a re-usable, custom Form that will enable you to have fillable fields, checkboxes, and dynamic tables.

episodes.title: Customize Interface
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne show you how to customize the Word 2016 User Interface(UI) to suit your personal tastes. Specific customizations covered here includes: customizing the Ribbon, custom keyboard shortcuts, editing options, printing options, and more.
